description: Facts and certain transport-related documents about the London Borough of Lambeth

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We partner with Lambeth to implement the Mayor's Transport Strategy in the borough."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP)"}
The LIP is produced by the London Borough of Lambeth and agreed with us. It sets out the details on transport infrastructure changes in a three-year period to support the Mayor's Transport Strategy .

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) allocation 2019/20","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lambeth-2019-20-lip-allocation-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 220KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2017/18 - Borough Leader","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/1718-lip-confirmation-leader-letter-lambeth.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 74KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2016/17","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lip-funding-confirmation-letters-16-17-lambeth.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 75KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) delivery plan letter","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lambeth-lip-delivery-plan-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 60KB","image":{}},{"title":"Public Transport Access Levels - Lambeth","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/public-transport-access-levels-lambeth.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 3.01MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Find out more about LIP funding.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"LIP targets for Lambeth"}
Each borough has set targets in their LIP against the Mayor's Transport Strategy outcomes - we track and report on progress against these targets in the LIP3 MTS outcomes borough data pack .
For example, the car ownership in the borough was 66,943 in 2017. The LIP target to reduce car ownership by 2021 is 64,200.
Residents in Lambeth made an average of 788,000 trips each day between 2015 and 2018 by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car and motorcycle: 22%","Tube/DLR: 13%","National Rail and London Overground: 6%","Bus/Tram: 16%","Taxi/Other: 2%","Cycle: 5%","Walking: 36%"]}
We also work with boroughs to encourage more cycling . We recorded 31,149 daily cycle trips on average starting in Lambeth between 2015 and 2018.
More resident and visitor population figures are on the GLA website.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Funding for your borough"}
We provide funding to boroughs and local communities for transport improvements in your local area.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Vision Zero"}

We are working with boroughs to reduce the number of deaths and serious injuries from all road collisions to zero by 2041. They are responsible for enforcing safe speeds on their roads, as well as leading community programmes to encourage using roads safely. Find out more about Vision Zero .
In 2017 there were 207 individuals killed or seriously injured in Lambeth. Our target for 2022 is to reduce this number to 146.
Find out more about collisions in your borough.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're working on in Lambeth"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["We consult local communities on a range of projects every year - \u003ca href=\"https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/consultation_finder/?advanced=1\u0026st=open\"\u003esearch on the TfL Consultation Hub\u003c/a\u003e ","Find out about \u003ca href=\"/status-updates/major-works-and-events\"\u003emajor works and events near you\u003c/a\u003e ","See some ongoing TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/?Borough=Lambeth\"\u003eimprovements and projects in or near Lambeth\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Work now going on in your borough includes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003ea\u003c/strong\u003e - we're working with Lambeth Council to return the one-way road system to two-way and improve the area for people walking and cycling with more cycle and pedestrian crossings, segregated lanes and parking for cyclists. We'll also create new public spaces and improve existing ones. A new central bus station will work in a two-way arrangement","\u003cstrong\u003ea\u003c/strong\u003e - we plan to pedestrianise part of the roundabout to create a new public space, an improved bus station and better environment for people using public transport, walking and cycling","\u003cstrong\u003eStreatham Hill A23\u003c/strong\u003e - this project supports the Mayor's \u003ca href=\"/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/healthy-streets\"\u003eHealthy Streets\u003c/a\u003e ambitions by rebalancing road space and encouraging more people to walk, cycle and use public transport without hurting bus journey times and reliability"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus network changes"}
From time to time - after consulting the public - we alter bus routes to reflect changing patterns in demand. We also make temporary changes, often because of road works. See the latest bus changes.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ)"}
To improve air quality the ULEZ will extend to parts of Lambeth from October 2021 .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Our assets in Lambeth"}
Assets we maintain in your borough include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["10 Tube stations","Two London Overground stations","Around 560 bus stops - \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps_/bus-spider-maps?Query=Lambeth\"\u003esee all 77 day bus routes in Lambeth\u003c/a\u003e ","One bus station and Brixton garage","60 Santander Cycles docking stations","One TfL pier (Festival)","Five taxi ranks","Around 290 traffic signals","Cycle Superhighway 7 which runs from Merton to the City of London","Over 31 kilometres of \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/modes/driving/red-routes/red-route-maps\"\u003ered routes\u003c/a\u003e "]}
See a map of our assets in London.
We maintain our assets until they need to be renewed or disposed of as set out in our asset management plan. We do this by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Servicing them regularly to keep them operational","Repairing or replacing faulty assets"]}
Report a problem on a London street with our Streetcare tool .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"We do not maintain in Lambeth:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Non-red route roads - these roads are maintained by \u003ca href=\"https://www.lambeth.gov.uk/\"\u003eLambeth\u003c/a\u003e ","Litter removal on red routes - this is also the borough's responsibility","Network Rail track at London Overground stations - \u003ca href=\"https://www.networkrail.co.uk/communities/contact-us/\"\u003econtact Network Rail\u003c/a\u003e ","Taxis and mini cabs - these are owned by \u003ca href=\"/modes/taxis-and-minicabs/what-to-expect-from-your-journey\"\u003etaxi drivers and minicab offices \u003c/a\u003e ","Three bus garage in Lambeth - these are \u003ca href=\"/modes/buses/who-runs-your-bus\"\u003eowned and managed by bus companies\u003c/a\u003e ","Coaches"," \u003ca href=\"/info-for/taxis-and-private-hire/taxi-ranks\"\u003eTaxi ranks\u003c/a\u003e on borough roads. Cars and other vehicles parked on taxi ranks can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.lambeth.gov.uk/parking-transport-and-streets/contact-the-parking-transport-and-streets-teams\"\u003ereported to Lambeth\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Report private hire vehicles (PHVs) parked on ranks or unattended taxis on ranks directly to us.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dealing with severe weather"}
For documents relating to winter service in the boroughs, go to the Streets publications page .
